results.title: A Trip to Mexico: an integrated approach
results.creator_credit: Lily Steiner, Jeff Spencer and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
An enthusiastic approach to integrated curriculum at Southvale Primary School. A program full of ideas where the subject areas are integrated into a complex unit of work based on a trip to China and Mexico.

results.title: A Trip from Chicago
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”
Discusses ideas for advanced forms of public transport over varying distances of hundreds or thousands of miles. High-speed ground vehicles using rocket power and roller bearings, sealed tubes or air-cushion support, vertical takeoff aircraft, jets and rockets are discussed with their designers and prototypes are demonstrated. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: A Tribute to Sir Winston Churchill, K.G.
results.brief_description: A biographical film in honour of Sir Winston Churchill’s 80th birthday, dealing with his early life, education and his emergence into public life. It goes on to recall details of his political career, particularly as Britain’s leader throughout the war years, and ends with the presentation made to him by the two Houses of Parliament at a ceremony in Westminster Hall on the occasion of his 80th birthday.
results.title_for_label: A Tribute to Sir Winston Churchill, K.G.

results.title: A Tree is planted
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper Films and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: An account of the work of re-afforestation being carried out year by year in Scotland. Shows the men who work in the Scottish forests and stresses the vital need for reafforestation and tree care, pointing to the numerous skills which are part of the everyday job.

results.title: A Tree grows in Brooklyn [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Louis D Lighton, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Betty Smith, “A Tree grows in Brooklyn” follows the fortunes of a family struggling to make ends meet in the tenements of Brooklyn at the turn of the century. The alcoholic father, a singing waiter earning an uncertain income, talks of better times ahead. It is the mother who holds the family together and the daughter who tries to rise above their circumstances. Elia Kazan’s first film was praised at the time of its release for convincing performances and the richly detailed studio recreation of working class life. Cast includes: Dorothy McGuire, Joan Blondell, James Dunn, Lloyd Nolan and Peggy Ann Garner. Music by Alfred Newman.

results.title: A Trade for tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Eric Porter Productions, Film Australia and Michael Robertson

results.title: A Track winding back
results.brief_description: Presents a sketch of life in Gundagai, NSW around the turn of the century utilising contemporary photographs and written records. Covers architecture, fashion, medicine, politics, problems of workers, the departure of troops for the Boer War and the celebration of Commonwealth Day.

results.title: A Touch of zen
results.creator_credit: Hsia Liang-fang, Optimum Releasing and King Hu
results.brief_description: Made long before “Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon” this wonderful martial arts epic will linger with you both for its atmospheric and mystical images and its lyrical and mysterious storyline. Set during the time of the Ming Dynasty in a rural village outside Peking, the story begins with the artist Ku Shen-chai who lives with his mother in a supposedly haunted, run-down fort. The arrival of a stranger, Ou-Yang Yin, to the village stirs the curiosity within Ku only to be further flamed by the sudden appearance of a beautiful woman named Yang Hui-Ching. Plot and sub-plot are interwoven to form an intricate tale binding the three protagonists in a web of intrigue and mystery. This is not a full-on action-packed martial arts film but the scenes of combat are impressively creative and beautifully performed. Cast includes Hsu Feng, Tien Peng, Hsueh Han, Shih Chun, Pai Ying. Photography by Hua Hui-ying.

results.title: A Touch of hands (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of Pittsburgh and James T. Crawford
results.brief_description: Documentary on expressive arts therapist, Ed Lilley’s work with a group of emotionally handicapped children as they prepare a puppet show. The children are shown playing group games, preparing the puppets and set, rehearsing and finally performing their show. The aim of this therapy is to allow the children to extend themselves and improve their self images
